intro: Petamenes quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-angle plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its square-shaped stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
